Description: Two joining fragments of floor of North Ionian black-figured pottery plate; white slip; glaze fired variously brown to orange-red; on floor, ridge around tondo decorated with dots and two lines on its inside; to centre, series of griffin protomes (seven preserved) to left; underside, ridged, glazed save one reserved band.
Curator's comments: This sherd almost certainly belongs with GR 1924.12-1.978, which preserved a band of tongues at the centre.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1039)
